definition: ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions

sentences.english: If I have one more ticket, will you go with me?
sentences.chinese: 如果，我多一张船票，你会不会跟我一起走？

sentences.english: Tickets of the Navigation Co. entitle the holder to break the journey at London and Paris.
sentences.chinese: 该轮船公司的船票容许持票人在伦敦和巴黎滞留。

sentences.english: He bought a ticket to travel in the second class on the boat trip.
sentences.chinese: 他买了一张二等舱的船票去旅行。

sentences.english: When grown up, I remained homesick, but it became a ticket.
sentences.chinese: 长大后，乡愁是一张窄窄的船票。

sentences.english: Jack: Winning that ticket was thebest thing that ever happened to me.
sentences.chinese: 赢得船票是我一生中最幸运的事。

sentences.english: There was no stadium and European teams baulked at the cost of the boat journey.
sentences.chinese: 没有体育场，欧洲球队也因船票太贵难以成行。

sentences.english: A maximum of two sets tickets can be redeemed per suite.
sentences.chinese: 每间房最多只可换领两套船票。

sentences.english: If I have two steamer tickets, would you have left with me?
sentences.chinese: 如果我有两章船票，你愿和我一起走么。

sentences.english: Jack:Winning that ticket, Rose, was the best thing that ever happend to me.
sentences.chinese: 赢得那张船票是我一生的幸运。

sentences.english: The travel agent booked our vacation cruise.
sentences.chinese: 旅行社的人预订了我们假期的船票。

sentences.english: Sam quickly paid for his ticket and boarded the first outward-bound ship he could find.
sentences.chinese: 山姆很快地买了第一班出航的船票并登上了船。

sentences.english: The people who were able to purchase tickets and make the trip to the United States were called immigrants.
sentences.chinese: 那些有钱买船票来到美国的人称为移民。

sentences.english: Are there any unreserved first class cabin?
sentences.chinese: 还有没有一等舱的船票？

sentences.english: Can I book ship tickets here?
sentences.chinese: 你这里可不可以预购船票？

sentences.english: If I had two steamer tickets, would you go with me?
sentences.chinese: 如果我有两章船票，你愿和我一起走么。

definition: to embark/to travel by ship/to ferry
